    • Method Detail

      • setBoundedQueue

        public void setBoundedQueue(int capacity)
        Parameters:
        capacity - max queue size.

      • setUnboundedQueue

        public void setUnboundedQueue()
        The queue is bounded by default: see Enqueuer.defaultCapacity. And you should prefer bounded queues.

      • setId

        public void setId(java.lang.Object id)
        Optional user associated id.
        Parameters:
        id - must have good readable toString() representation

      • setThreadPool

        public void setThreadPool(java.util.concurrent.Executor threadPool)

      • usePreallocatedQueue

        public void usePreallocatedQueue()
        Queue choice option

        This option is auto-enabled if the setBoundedQueue capacity is less than Enqueuer.smallCapacity; It makes no sense for unbounded queue case.

      • useLockFreeQueue

        public void useLockFreeQueue()
        Queue choice option

        Unbounded queue case is always lock-free, it is based on CLQ. Bounded queue case is based on LBQ or ABQ (if usePreallocatedQueue). If you want bounded queue to be lock-free you must - enable options: usePreallocatedQueue() and useLockFreeQueue() - include org.jctools:jctools-core:2.1.1+ dependency

      • setCustomQueueCreator

        public void setCustomQueueCreator(Enqueuer.QueueCreator c)
        Use this method only if you understand what you're doing.

        public void disableSameThreadOptimization()
